moves.1... c6: Marcus Kann smiled in heaven... for now.
moves.4. c4: The attacking line. If Black plays 4... P-K3, he loses the best feature of the Caro-Kann -- the ability to freely develop his QB.
moves.4... Bf5: 4... N-KB3 guards the P and leaves the development of the B open.
moves.5... Qxd5: ...White forces the recapture with the Q.
moves.6... Qa5: Better is the simple retreat 6... Q-Q1. Both sides would have 1 piece developed and Black's game would be quite tenable.
moves.8. Nd5: If Black now tries 8... Q-QB3??? to keep the QNP defended, Whitte has 9 B-QN5!!! winning the Q!
moves.9. axb3: ..but now Black resigns. White threatens 10 N-B7 ch with a shakrukh or 10 N-N6 PxN 11 RxR winning the Exchange. 9... N-R3 sems to guard everything but White has 10 RxN!! PxR 11 N-B7 ch ending up a piece ahead.
